de.tum.in.tumcampus.auxiliary

Class AccessTokenManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.tum.in.tumcampus.auxiliary.AccessTokenManager

  • public class AccessTokenManager
extends java.lang.Object
    Easy accessible class for token management.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int MIN_LRZ_LENGTH 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      AccessTokenManager(android.content.Context context) 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String generateAccessToken(java.lang.String lrz_id)
      get a new access token for TUMOnline by passing the lrz ID due to the simplicity of the given xml file we only need to parse the <token> element using an xml-parser is simply to much... just extract the pattern via regex
      boolean hasValidAccessToken()
      Test if a valid access token already exists
      boolean requestAccessToken(java.lang.String lrzId)
      Internal method for setting a new token.
      void setupAccessToken()
      Generates an access token and if there already is an access token a dialog is shown which asks the user if he wants to generate a new one

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

        public static final int MIN_LRZ_LENGTH
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Constructor Detail

      • AccessTokenManager

        public AccessTokenManager(android.content.Context context)

    • Method Detail

      • generateAccessToken

        public java.lang.String generateAccessToken(java.lang.String lrz_id)
        get a new access token for TUMOnline by passing the lrz ID due to the simplicity of the given xml file we only need to parse the <token> element using an xml-parser is simply to much... just extract the pattern via regex
        Parameters:
        lrz_id - lrz user id
        Returns:
        the access token

      • hasValidAccessToken

        public boolean hasValidAccessToken()
        Test if a valid access token already exists
        Returns:
        True, if access token is set

      • requestAccessToken

        public boolean requestAccessToken(java.lang.String lrzId)
        Internal method for setting a new token. It uses the given lrzId to generate a new access token, which is saved to shared preferences afterwards
        Parameters:
        lrzId - LRZ id
        Returns:
        True if new access token has been set successfully

      • setupAccessToken

        public void setupAccessToken()
        Generates an access token and if there already is an access token a dialog is shown which asks the user if he wants to generate a new one
